name: Taekyoung "Ted" Kwon
content: Ted "Taekyoung" Kwon's Home page Taekyoung Kwon Short Bio Taekyoung (Ted) Kwon is an associate professor at the School of Computer Science and Engineering, Seoul National University (SNU), South Korea. He was a visiting professor at Rutgers university in 2010. Before joining SNU, he was a Postdoctoral Research Associate at University of California Los Angeles (UCLA), and at City University New York (CUNY). He obtained BS, MS and PhD degrees from the Department of Computer Engineering, SNU, in 1993, 1995, 2000, respectively. During his graduate program, he was a visiting student at IBM T.J. Watson Research Center and at University of North Texas. His research interest lies in future Internet, content-oriented networking, and wireless networks. Research Area Future internet architecture Information-centric networking Peer-to-peer Mobile/wireless networking Multimedia streaming Career 2013 - Present: Professor, Seoul National University Apr. 2008 - 2013: Associate Professor, Seoul National University Feb. 2004 - Mar. 2008: Assistant Professor, Seoul National University Mar. 2003 - Jan. 2004: Post-doctoral Researcher, City University New York Sept. 2002 - Mar. 2003: Principal Engineer, IST International Inc. Dec. 2000 - Aug. 2002: Post-doctoral Researcher, UCLA Sept. 2000 - Nov. 2000: Post-doctoral Researcher, Soongsil University Mar. 2000 - Aug. 2000: Part-time lecturer, Hanyang University Jan. 1999 - Apr. 1999: Visiting scholar, University of North Texas Mar. 1998 - Jun. 1998: Visiting student, IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center Education Aug. 2000: Ph.D., School of Computer Science and Engineering, Seoul National University Feb. 1995: M.S., Dept. of Computer Engineering, Seoul National University Feb. 1993: B.S., Dept. of Computer Engineering, Seoul National University Publications Please click here ( before 2004 ) Contact me at E-mail: tkkwon@snu.ac.kr Tel: +82-2-880-9105 Address: Building 301, Room 503 ENG 4190 Seoul National University Shinlim-dong, Kwanak-gu Seoul Korea 151-744
